arts.ttl: Ryan Reynolds reveals awkward first meeting with Wrexham's record signing before home loss to West Brom
arts.sum: Ryan Reynolds has recounted an unexpectedly awkward first meeting with Wrexham's record signing Nathan Broadhead, just ahead of the club's home defeat to West Bromwich Albion . Broadhead, who played in the Premier League as recently as May, returned to the Welsh club where he began his career, signing a four-year deal from Ipswich in a move reported to include a $10.1 million initial fee.

arts.ttl: Wrexham falls to West Brom 3-2 at home for back-to-back losses in Championship
arts.sum: Wrexham is still searching for its first points in the Championship after a 3-2 loss to West Brom on Saturday. Price’s second strike gave West Brom a two-goal cushion in the 81st before Sam Smith made it 3-2 moments before the final whistle.

arts.ttl: Isaac Price doubles up as West Brom’s changes blow Wrexham away
arts.athr: Sam Dalling at Stōk Cae Ras
arts.sum: With the spotlight fixed on their Hollywood infused opposition, it is easily forgettable that West Brom’s Ryan Mason is just lighting the touchpaper on a hopefully lengthy and fruitful managerial career. Mason will know already that he will thrive or fail on his substitutions, and a double switch that earned three precious Championship points should boost his confidence. Mikey Johnston had been on the pitch for 28 seconds when he found Jed Wallace to his left. Wallace had entered at the same time and beat the goalkeeper Danny Ward with his second touch. There will doubtless have been groans in the away end as Tom Fellows, who set up Isaac Price’s opener and had been as lively as a child with unlimited fizzy sweet supplies, departed for Wallace. That disappointment soon dissipated and was replaced by unrestrained joy when seven minutes later Johnston found Price for a headed second. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Price stars as West Brom win at Wrexham
arts.sum: Wrexham co-owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney saw West Brom spoil their Championship return on home soil with a 3-2 win at the SToK Cae Ras.

arts.ttl: Wrexham vs West Bromwich Albion – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Wrexham and West Bromwich Albion go head-to-head in the Championship on Saturday. Both sides will be searching for a positive start to their respective seasons, with Wrexham making their Championship debut last week following three successive promotions. arts.ttl: Wrexham vs West Bromwich Albion – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Wrexham continue their return to Championship life with their first second-tier home game at the Racecourse Ground since 1982 when they host West Bromwich Albion on Saturday. The Red Dragons aim to respond to a late defeat at Southampton, while the Baggies arrive off the back of a 1-0 opening-day win over Blackburn Rovers.
